sentences.en: A behaviorist, B. F. Skinner , sees humans as beings whose behavior is almost completely shaped by their surroundings.
sentences.cn: 一位名叫B. F. 斯金纳的行为主义者认为,人的行为模式完全是由周围环境塑造的.

sentences.en: And from a behaviorist point of view this is because of the associative history of these things.
sentences.cn: 在行为主义者看来,这是在这些事物之间的联结历史造成的。

sentences.en: As the behaviorist tells us, man can be thought of as "an assembled organic machine ready to run.
sentences.cn: 正如行为主义者告诉我们的，一个人被看作是“一台组装好的即将发动的机器”。

sentences.en: Starting from this manifest falsehood, the behaviorist proposes to operate the "human Ford" the way the operator drives his car.
sentences.cn: 从这个明显谬论开始，行为主义者设想着用驾驶员开车的方式驾驶我们这辆“人类福特”。
